title: A Split Week in San Quentin
Nothing Equals Nothing
description: When Sarah Sykes murders her husband, Sam decides her only defense is to plead insanity.

title: Tears for a Nobody Doll
description: Sam represents a woman whose in-laws are attempting to gain custody of her unborn child because she is mentally retarded.

title: Life Is a Lie, Love Is a Cheat
The View from an Ivory Tower
Too Many Strangers
description: Sam defends a young man charged with murdering a member of a prominent San Francisco man.

title: The Target Over the Hill
description: A mother contests her son's adoption proceeding, claiming that she has conquered her drug problem and can provide a good home environment for the boy.

title: Not Even the Gulls Shall Weep
Run Softly, Oh Softly
description: A man who swindled an insurance company out of hundreds of thousands of dollars asks Sam to help his daughter out of serious difficulties.

title: Sugar and Spice and Everything...
description: Hank Tabor must defend a dancer accused of murder when Sam is tied up representing another client at the same time.

title: Some Fires Die Slowly
description: Sam defends a man who is accused of arson and insurance fraud.

title: Image of a Toad
description: A prisoner falls in love with Alcatraz's psychologist who is trying to help him earn parole.

title: Seventeen Gypsies and a Sinner Named Charlie
description: A con man who has swindled large sums of money from local charities states that he only took the money to support his seventeen children whom he claims to have adopted.

title: Of Rusted Cannons and Fallen Sparrows
description: A man retains Sam when he feels his right to free speech is being threatened when he speaks out against bigotry and racial intolerance. In the mean time, Hank defends a woman accused of being a Communist.
